info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 2:00AM PDT until April 19 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally high amounts of 9 to 12 inches above 5500 feet elevation Winds gusting as high as 35 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...In Oregon, Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades including higher portions of Highway 140 near Lake of the Woods. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected Monday evening with up to 1 inch per hour accumulations possible at times. Periods of heavy snow combined with gusty winds may result in near white out conditions at times Monday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
